title: The Darkin lores are incredible, I just have one question.
body:
At least I think so.

Aatrox's further characterization through his bio and 'The Cage' helps cement one of what I already thought was one of the better characters to help represent the new canon, and 'Twilight of the Gods' was an absolute pleasure to read throughout. Filling out the history and lore makes the fantasy behind League of Legends so much more enjoyable to immerse into.

I just have one question.

How come Aatrox and Rhaast appear to be some kind of melding of armour and flesh, Varus looks very much like Void corruption, yet they're now confirmed to have undergone the same ascension ritual as Azir, Nasus, Renekton, and the other ascended/sunborn/darkin from Twilight of the Gods, but they're not animal-themed?

What do you mean "darkins are a race"?
In the lore, the word "darkin" means "the fallen". It's a name that mortals used to describe what the Ascended have become: God-warriors filled with greed and rage after the fall of Shurima and Azir.. Not a race, but simply a name.

The champion versions of Varus, Rhaast/Kayn and Aatrox are "possessed" human hosts, so their current form is only a reflection of what they were previously. In fact, in 'Twilight of the Gods', it is very heavily implied that the fallen Ascended were animalistic, but changing themselves over time through magic and sheer willpower.

The animal theming (or lack there of) has to do with the Shuriman language/orthography and cultural symbology.   
Somewhere between ancient egyptian and chinese ideographs, shuriman concepts have symbols --often with multiple meaning depending on the context. 

So the word/concept/symbol for "Lord or Emperor" might be a golden bird...  Thus when someone "embodies" that ideal -- they might take on some of that symbology.    But that does not mean all shuriman concepts are animalistic--

So non shurimans would likely end up looking vastly different?

Essentially an ascended christ would turn into an angel,while someone from ancient egypt would turn into somethig similar to Nasus,renekton or Azir.

Targon and Demacia (which has a deep cultural relationship with targon) have a different core language and symbolic tradition than shurima— so yes they represent the same “concepts” in very different ways.
 Shurima’s traditions and language favor symbolic animals and objects (birds, chains etc...) — while targon prefers celestial bodies or events (starlight, dawn, the moon) thus the manifestations of even similar concepts can be quite different.

This is a gold mine for theorycrafting.

I think the Darkin shuriman folks know and call are the typical Ascended. They are the Ascended after Fall of Shurima. But the Darkin we know, in view of reader, are the Ascended trapped in weapons. They are different because they lost their form, and what we see (red flesh of Rhaast and Aatrox) are the only what they can corrupt and reach to have a physical form in material universe. They can't reach to an actual ascended form anymore, that's why Aatrox is pissed off. That's literally the best they can do. A completely different form, a shadow of their glory.

That's why I believe when they were trapped in their weapons, they lost their form. That's why Aatrox misses his true form and says I will never will be glorious again. Vessels they corrupt can only become what you wouldn't say how an Ascended actually looks like. Not because it is their wish, but because it is their best. They miss being the Ascended and hate what they have become. A pathetic try that fails miserably.

Based on how many ascended there are, some might not be fully animal themed. 

And I blame the pit Varus was in
Xerath, we might remember, isn't animal themed, either. Perhaps he was a bit of a special case, too, but it's evidence.

Not much of a "special case" tbh, with him it is all working as intended. Ascension is a very simple process that just totally pumps up an individual with energy and changes their existencial position in the fabric of reality that they can naturally maintain this level of energy. However, the process is guided by the mental image of the ascending person - and as 99% of all visions of "the divine" was dervived from the animalistic gods of ancient Shurima, it's no surprise that the ascended will subconsciously immitated the image of their gods.

Xerath however was not a very theistic person, he was only after one ideal: total freedom. Freedom from any rule, any chains, and any sort of restriction - and a material body apparently also counted as such, so he has become a living mass of energy. In fact, he might be the "truest" ascended, true to what all ascended actually are: massive balls of energy given form by a sentinent mind.
